##  Hints
1. `az deployment group create --template-file ./labs/lab-vm/bicep/main.bicep --resource-group "nsec-training"`

2. The adminPassword parameter must be specified or provided upon template deployment. ` param adminPassword string = 'value'`

3. The userData is provided through Virtual Machine Properties in the module. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/templates/microsoft.compute/virtualmachines?pivots=deployment-language-bicep#virtualmachineproperties  


4. The userData can be accessed using the following command: `Invoke-RestMethod -Headers @{"Metadata"="true"} -Method GET  -Uri "http://169.254.169.254/metadata/instance/compute/userData?api-version=2021-01-01&format=text" `

5. To store the userdata in a variable and execute it, you can run the following: `$UserData = Invoke-RestMethod -Headers @{"Metadata"="true"} -Method GET  -Uri "http://169.254.169.254/metadata/instance/compute/userData?api-version=2021-01-01&format=text"  ; $decoded = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String($userData)) ; Invoke-Expression $decoded`

6. You can base64 encode the script using https://www.base64encode.org/

7. Add this to line 129 in the vm template `userData: '' `
